RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Michele Campagna, MSc in Civil Engineering, received his PhD in Planning & GIS in 2003 at the University of Cagliari, where he is currently Associate Professor of Spatial Planning and GIScience. He teaches master/doctoral courses in urban and regional planning, Geodesign and in GIScience , and is member of the PhD board in Civile engineering and Architecture. He is supervisor of Master and PhD thesis. He gave seminars or taught courses in several Universities in Italy, Portugal, Germany, Russian Federation, and Brazil. He is coordinator of several EU Erasmus Program bilateral agreements. He was coordinator of the International Summer School on Scenario Analysis in Urban and Regional Planning 2010, and of the International EU Erasmus IP Summer School on ICT in Spatial Planning 2011. He received several scholarships and grants by European and North American Institutions such as (European Commission; EU Leonardo and Marie Curie Programme; European Science Foundation; Centre for Integrated Social Sciences and US National Science Foundation). His main research interests include issues related to Geodesign, Planning theory, meta-planning, the ICT/GIS adoption and innovation in the planning practice including SDI, Planning Support Systems, Citizens Observation. He authored over 80 publications such as papers in major International journals, a book on geo-information technologies for spatial planning, and he is editor of a book on ?GIS for Sustainable Development?. He is panel member/reviewer of International Planning and GIS Conferences, and reviewer for books and international journals on GIS . He is AGILE contact person for the UrbanGIS lab at the University of Cagliari. He was planning and GIS consultant for the Italian Ministry of Environment, The Regional Government of Sardinia (IT), for private enterprises. He is responsible for research projects on Spatial Planning and on GIS at the University of Cagliari, and collaborated to several international and national research projects in Russia, Cuba, and Italy.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: - Research: principal investigator of several projects on Geographic Information Systems, Spatial Data Infrastructure, and Planning Support Systems for urban/regional/environmental planning and spatial governance; - Teaching (undergraduate, graduate, and PhD level): Professor of Spatial Planning, Geodesign, and GIScience - Academic governance: Member of the Faculty Board, Member of Graduate/PhD Course Boards - Internationalisation: Proposer and coordinator of 6 Erasmus Bilateral Agreements; Coordinator of the Erasmus IP International Summer School on ICT in Spatial Planning ?InfoPlan? - Coordinator fo Civile Engineering program (MSc/BSc)

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Dipartimento di Ingegneria Civile, Ambientale e Architettura DICAAR

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Mapping and the citizen sensor Descriptions are provided by the Actions directly via e-COST. Accurate and timely maps are a fundamental resource but their production in a changing world is a major scientific and practical grand challenge. Remote sensing provides images for mapping at unparalleled rates but the ground reference data needed in map production and evaluation are difficult to acquire. The rise of citizen sensors (e.g. volunteers contributing information from remote devices) provides immense potential to radically change mapping. The quality of citizen sensor data, however, is highly variable and activity is uncoordinated. A major internationally recognised mapping challenge is how to deal with the vast amounts of image data and large bank of uncoordinated citizen sensors in a way to allow accurate mapping. This Action will evaluate the utility of citizen sensors in mapping, debate means to encourage standardisation, coordination of activity and identify how mapping can proceed with imperfect data. It will produce protocols for the collection and use of volunteered data, encouraging good practices while not constraining volunteers. The work is highly inter-disciplinary, at the interface of ISCH, ICT, TUD, ESSEM, FA and FPS domains, and benefits from expertise distributed across Europe. The Action provides a means to foster advances mainly via networking of typically disparate groups for broad benefit.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Strategic Environmental Assessment and Spatial Data Infrastructures (SDI): new tools for Landscape Planning and spatial governance
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Strategic Environmental Assessment and Spatial Data Infrastructures (SDI): new tools for Landscape Planning and spatial governance, Situao: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa. , Integrantes: Michele Campagna - Coordenador.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: PON 2000/2006, Misura II.2. Societ dell?Informazione per il Sistema scientifico meridionale CyberSAR ?Simulazione modellistica nella pianificazione territoriale e ambientale
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Duties: In the CyberSAR project, I worked on a work package on simulation modelling for spatial, environmental and service planning. Main duties involved the development of a spatial database for the development of spatial complex network model. The work involved the use of the ESRI ArcGIS software for spatial data (vector and networks) integration and environmental analysis, and the implementation of routines for spatial and complex network analysis.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Modelagem Paramtrica da Ocupao Territorial: proposio de novos recursos das geotecnologias para representar e planejar o territrio urbano
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto tem como objetivo defender uma nova era no processo de elaborao dos projetos de planejamento e gesto urbana, resultado da evoluo nas tecnologias SIG (Sistemas de Informao Geogrfica) de representao espacial. A era do ps-modernismo est sendo substituda por novo momento ditado pela parametrizao. Favorece esta nova condio a significativa evoluo das geotecnologias, a ampla de difuso de seus recursos e a facilitao de seus usos devido disponibilizao de dados e aplicativos na rede mundial de computadores. As legislaes favoreceram o acesso s informaes e definiram que os projetos urbanos, necessariamente de interesse coletivo, devem ser discutidos e aprovados com a participao da comunidade, o que trouxe como exigncia a questo da visualizao da informao. Conduz discusso sobre a relao entre expresso grfica e visualizao no planejamento urbano, com vistas a favorecer a compreenso dos cidados a cerca das proposies e transformaes se seus territrios urbanos. Aborda valores contemporneos: interoperabilidade entre sistemas, investimento em tecnologias de visualizao, integrao da comunidade em VGI (Volunteered Geographic Information) e, sobretudo, processos metodolgicos baseados em Modelagem Paramtrica da Ocupao Territorial. Ir resultar na proposio, aplicao e avaliao de prottipos, baseados em tecnologia de geoprocessamento e rede mundial de computadores, para realizar a simulao da paisagem urbana projetada pelos parmetros urbansticos, com vistas a favorecer a compreenso e participao cidad no processo decisional sobre a modelagem de seu territrio. Os procedimentos tcnicos de referncia sero Sistemas de Informaes Geogrficas, Modelagem Paramtrica da Ocupao Territorial, Mapeamento Voluntariado (Volunteered Geographic Information) e estudos de Capacidade de Carga Urbana. Apoio: CNPq - Processo 405664/2013-3, Chamada MCTI/CNPq/MEC/CAPES N 43/2013

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientfico e Tecnolgico

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Geodesign e Modelagem Paramtrica da Ocupao Territorial: novos recursos das geotecnologias para gesto da paisagem da Regional Pampulha, Belo Horizonte
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O processo de Geodesign apresenta uma framework (estrutura de trabalho com etapas e processos metodolgicos) composta por etapas de aplicao de modelos que visam a caracterizao, anlise, proposio, simulao e ajustes na tomada de decises da ocupao do territrio. O processo bastante flexvel adaptao para as aplicaes dos modelos s realidades territoriais e culturais, pois necessrio projetar a paisagem de modo contextualizado s necessidades locais. A modelagem paramtrica da paisagem urbana composta pela aplicao de geotecnologias para visualizao e tomada de decises sobre os envelopes mximos que delimitam as edificaes no espao urbano, a partir de parmetros urbansticos. proposta a framework do Geodesign para gerenciar o processo de promoo da visualizao e participao cidad na tomada de decises sobre a paisagem resultante na aplicao dos parmetros reguladores, atravs de modelos de representao, processos, avaliao, mudana, impacto e, futuramente, de deciso. So discutidas e apresentados exemplos de aplicao de duas ferramentas de suporte ao visualizao e simulao da representao tridimensional, que passam pelas etapas de Planning Support Systems (PSS), Volunteered Geographic Information (VGI), Land Change Modeling (LCM) e Visualizao (City Engine). escolhido como estudo de caso de aplicao a regio da Pampulha em Belo Horizonte, como exemplos do state-of-design que ilustra os conceitos discutidos como state-of-art, e traduzem realidades brasileiras que so prottipos das necessidades da gesto da paisagem urbana no pas. Apoio CNPq: Processo 471089/2014-1 , Chamada MCTI/CNPQ /MEC/CAPES N 22/2014.
